episodeTitle: Luffy at the End of His Tether! An All-out Battle at the Oris Plaza!
description: Luffy pushes forward toward Ace's execution platform but becomes increasingly exhausted as he faces powerful Marine opponents. Whitebeard demonstrates his overwhelming power against the Admirals, while Garp makes a shocking move to defend the execution platform.

events.title: Ivankov Panics About Luffy's Condition
events.description: Ivankov tries to hear what's happening on the plaza while with Jinbe, and begins to panic about Luffy's deteriorating condition during the battle. He blames Jinbe for the situation.
events.significance: Shows the concern of Luffy's allies and the stakes of the battle as Luffy pushes himself beyond his limits.

events.title: Marco Thanks Little Oars Jr.
events.description: Marco expresses gratitude to Little Oars Jr. for his help in creating a path for the Whitebeard Pirates to advance toward the execution platform.
events.significance: Acknowledges Little Oars Jr.'s sacrifice and contribution to the rescue mission despite his severe injuries.

events.title: Whitebeard Commands Pirates and Readies Shockwave
events.description: Whitebeard commands his pirates to clear the way as he prepares to unleash a powerful shockwave using his Gura Gura no Mi (Tremor-Tremor Fruit) abilities.
events.significance: Demonstrates Whitebeard's overwhelming power and his strategic command of the battlefield during the war.

quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Commanding his pirates to make room for his attack

events.title: Aokiji's Ice Ball Debut
events.description: Admiral Aokiji attempts to freeze Whitebeard using his Ice Ball technique, but discovers he cannot freeze Whitebeard's vibrations from the Gura Gura no Mi.
events.significance: First appearance of Aokiji's Ice Ball technique, while also demonstrating the defensive capabilities of Whitebeard's Devil Fruit powers against freezing.

events.title: Aokiji Impaled by Whitebeard
events.description: Aokiji attempts to freeze Whitebeard at point-blank range after being impaled by him. However, Jozu intervenes and shatters Aokiji's ice body before he can complete the freezing attack.
events.significance: Shows the extreme measures the Admirals are willing to take and demonstrates Jozu's crucial role in protecting Whitebeard.

events.title: Aokiji Regenerates Despite Injury
events.description: After being shattered by Jozu, Aokiji quickly regenerates his ice body, though he sustains a slight injury in the process.
events.significance: Demonstrates the regenerative capabilities of Logia-type Devil Fruit users even when facing powerful opponents.

events.title: Luffy and Pirates Continue Forward
events.description: Luffy and the Whitebeard Pirates maintain their advance toward the execution platform, despite heavy resistance from Marine forces.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's determination to save Ace even as his strength wanes.

events.title: Garp Behaves Strangely - Internal Conflict
events.description: Garp starts to behave strangely as he watches Luffy advance, torn between his duty as a Marine and his love for his grandson. Sengoku notices Garp's conflict and expresses concern.
events.significance: Reveals Garp's deep internal conflict between his Marine duties and familial bonds, foreshadowing his difficult decision.

events.title: Vice Admiral Attacks Luffy
events.description: Luffy is attacked by a Vice Admiral while trying to advance, showing the exhaustion taking its toll on him.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's weakening state as he pushes forward through increasingly powerful opponents.

events.title: Kizaru Blasts Luffy with Light Beams
events.description: Admiral Kizaru strikes Luffy with his light beam attacks, severely injuring the already exhausted pirate. This attack enrages Garp, but Sengoku quickly reminds him of his position as a Marine.
events.significance: Shows the increasing danger to Luffy and heightens Garp's emotional turmoil watching his grandson suffer.

events.title: Whitebeard Expresses Admiration for Luffy
events.description: Whitebeard claims that he likes people like Luffy, acknowledging the young pirate's determination and spirit in trying to save Ace.
events.significance: Shows Whitebeard's respect for Luffy and recognizes him as a worthy ally in the battle to save Ace.

events.title: Whitebeard vs Akainu - Clash of Titans
events.description: Whitebeard readies a shockwave attack, but Admiral Akainu prevents it. The two begin an intense fight showcasing massive destructive power between earthquake and magma abilities.
events.significance: One of the most significant clashes in the Marineford War, pitting the world's strongest man against one of the most powerful Admirals.

events.title: Garp Punches Marco
events.description: As Marco flies toward the execution platform to rescue Ace, Garp suddenly jumps up and delivers a devastating punch using Busoshoku Haki, sending Marco flying away and shocking everyone present.
events.significance: Garp makes his choice to defend the execution platform, demonstrating his incredible power and his ultimate decision to uphold his Marine duty despite his personal feelings.

events.title: Garp Declares His Stance
events.description: After punching Marco away, Garp declares that whoever wants to pass the execution platform must kill him first, making his position clear to all combatants.
events.significance: Garp publicly commits to defending the execution platform, solidifying his choice between duty and family in one of the war's most emotionally charged moments.

quotes.text: If you want to pass, you'll have to kill me first!
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Declaring his commitment to defend the execution platform

quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Commanding his pirates to make room for his attack

quotes.text: If you want to pass, you'll have to kill me first!
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Declaring his commitment to defend the execution platform

themes.description: The episode heavily explores Garp's internal conflict between his duty as a Marine and his love for his grandsons Luffy and Ace.
themes.symbolism: Garp's punch to Marco symbolizes his ultimate choice to uphold his Marine duty, even at the cost of his family's happiness.

themes.description: Both Whitebeard and the Admirals demonstrate incredible destructive capabilities, showing why they are considered the strongest forces in the One Piece world.
themes.symbolism: The clash between Whitebeard and Akainu represents the collision of old and new generations of power.

themes.description: Luffy continues pushing forward despite exhaustion, while allies like Little Oars Jr. and the Whitebeard Pirates sacrifice themselves for the rescue mission.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's battered body represents the price of unwavering determination.

characterSpotlights.development: Garp's internal struggle reaches a climax as he makes the difficult decision to actively defend the execution platform against those trying to save his grandson Ace.
keyActions: Shows visible signs of conflict while watching Luffy
Becomes angry when Kizaru attacks Luffy
Declares he will defend the execution platform
quotes: If you want to pass, you'll have to kill me first!

characterSpotlights.development: Whitebeard demonstrates why he's called the world's strongest man, holding his own against multiple Admirals while showing respect for Luffy's determination.
Luffy's physical condition deteriorates significantly as he faces increasingly powerful opponents, yet he refuses to give up on saving Ace.
keyActions: Takes damage from Vice Admirals and Kizaru

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several battle sequences for dramatic effect, particularly the Whitebeard vs Aokiji confrontation.

trivia.fact: This episode adapted Chapter 567, pages 3-19 of the manga.
The episode's TV rating in Japan was 9.8%, ranking 5th for its timeslot.
Ice Ball is Aokiji's technique that debuted in this episode, though it failed to fully freeze Whitebeard due to his vibration powers.
The eyecatcher for this episode featured Zoro and Sanji.
